description: Minor material amendment (S.73) to remove condition 10 (proposed first floor rear window of each dwellinghouse hereby approved shall be fitted with obscure glass and non opening for a height of 1.7m from finished floor level) pursuant to planning permission reference 195415FUL dated 15/07/2020 for: Construction of four attached two storey dwellinghouses with loft accommodation (following demolition of existing detached bungalow at no. 20A Balmoral Gardens)
decision_conditions: The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with: drawing numbers: 19004_S.02 (site location plan), 19004_DE.01 (demolition ground floor plan), 19004_DE.02 (demolition elevations), 19004_EX.01 (existing floor plan), 19004_EX.01 (existing elevations), 19004_GE.04 (proposed side elevation), received: 23.12.2019 drawing numbers: 19004_GA.01 (Rev. A; proposed ground floor plan), 19004_GA.03 (Rev. A; proposed second floor plan), 19004_GA.04 (Rev. A; proposed roof plan), 19004_GE.03 (Rev. A; proposed rear elevation), 19004_GS.01 (Rev. A; section AA), 19004_GS.02 (Rev. A; section BB), 19004_GS.03 (Rev A; section CC), received via email: 31.03.2020 drawing numbers: 19004_GE.01 (Rev B; context elevations), 19004_GE.02 (Rev B; proposed front elevation), 19004_GA.02 (Rev. B; proposed first floor plan), received via email: 22.05.2020
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, in the interest of proper planning.

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, C, D, E and F of Schedule 2, Part 1, Class A of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015, as amended (or any other order revoking and re-enacting that order, with or without modifications), no extensions or alterations shall be carried out to any of the dwellinghouses hereby approved without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of occupiers of adjoining properties and the appearance of the street scene, in accordance with policies 1.1 (g) and (h) of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy, policy 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policy DAA of Ealing's Local Plan (Reg.22), policies D3 and D6 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2025).

| The sound insulation of the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses, namely, bedrooms adjoining main entrance staircases of separate dwellings, should be enhanced by at least 5dB above the recommended Building Regulations value. The assessment and mitigation measures shall be based on standards of the Council's SPG10 (Noise and Vibration) and the criteria of BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) policy DAA of Ealing's Local Plan (Reg.22), policy D14 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2025).
| The two cycle parking spaces shown for each dwellinghouse on approved drawing number 19004-GA.01 (Rev. A) shall be secure and sheltered and implemented prior to first occupation of the development.

Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with National Planning Policy Framework 2025 - section 9 Sustainable Transport, Ealing's Sustainable Transport SPG and Policy T5 of the London Plan (2021).

| The refuse and recycling storage shall be implemented in accordance with the Local Planning Authority policies before the first occupation of the dwellings hereby approved and retained permanently thereafter.

Reason: To provide adequate refuse and recycling storage to protect the amenities of the area and the living conditions of occupiers of the proposed residential units and the surrounding area, in accordance with policy 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policy SI 8 of the London Plan (2021) and Ealing Council's Waste and Recycling Guidance
